intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion murorum subsp. ebelii, commonly known as the Ebel's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has basal leaves that are usually lobed or dissected, and its stems are often hairy. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphological traits and geographic distribution.
